intro: Epidendrum reflexitepalum, commonly known as the reflexed lip epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its erect, often branched growth habit and produces showy, fragrant flowers with a distinctive reflexed lip. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often on trees or rocks. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are usually pink to purple in color, with a three-lobed lip that is reflexed backward, giving the plant its common name.
